article.name: KnowBe4 Security Awareness Training (KSAT) Change Log
article.title: KnowBe4 Security Awareness Training (KSAT) Change Log
article.body:
Use this article to stay up-to-date with changes to the KnowBe4 console.

Note: Changes may include new, updated, deprecated, or removed features. KnowBe4 reserves the right to terminate access to, use of, and support of features that are included as part of the Subscription Services, which is common with SaaS services, as they are constantly changing and improving. This allows us to adapt to the evolving cybersecurity industry so we can provide current, high-quality services.

See the table below for a list of updates, with the latest updates displayed at the top.

Release Date Description
November 2025
  • November 25, 2025 - We’ve added an Asana on CloudEagle integration for the KSAT console. Integrating these apps allows you to access detailed information about organizations, view user lists, manage user accounts, and monitor accurate usage of the Asana platform through user login activity. For more information, see our Integrate Asana on CloudEagle into Your KSAT Console article.
  • November 24, 2025 - We’re excited to announce the release of our new navigation menu, enhanced login page, and updated KnowBe4 logo! These updates will be rolled out by region, on the following schedule:
    Nov 24, 2025: DE
    Nov 25, 2025: UK
    Nov 26, 2025: CA
    For additional information, see our Login Page and Navigation Menu Overview article.
  • November 19, 2025 - We’ve added a Workato integration for the KSAT console. This integration allows you to utilize Workbots for conversational process automation, allowing users to initiate KnowBe4 actions, view statuses, or receive context-aware notifications directly within Slack or Microsoft Teams. For more information, see our Integrate Workato into Your KSAT Console article.
  • November 18, 2025 - We’ve added a Make integration for the KSAT console. This integration allows you to design and deploy event-driven, real-time automations that respond instantly to user actions, such as failed phishing tests or course completions. For more information, see our Integrate Make into Your KSAT Console article.
  • November 18, 2025 - We’ve added a Tray integration for the KSAT console. This integration allows you to create highly customizable and easy-to-build workflows, enabling deep integrations with niche, proprietary, or highly customized internal security tools. For more information, see our Integrate Tray into Your KSAT Console article.
  • November 17, 2025 - We’ve added an Anzenna integration to the KSAT console. This integration allows you to send Phishing Security Test (PST) data to Anzenna for additional security recommendations. For more information, see Anzenna’s Onboarding Anzenna: Connecting KnowBe4 article.
  • Nov 13, 2025 - We’ve united our creative teams under a single brand: KnowBe4 Studios. Moving forward, you’ll find new ModStore content released under this name. Read more about the KnowBe4 Studios launch.
  • November 12, 2025 - We’ve removed the Risk Score option from the User Field drop-down menu in our Smart Groups feature. Smart Groups using this option will be automatically migrated to our new SmartRisk Agent criteria. For more information, see the SmartRisk Agent™ Criteria section of our Smart Groups Glossary of Criteria Types article.
  • November 12, 2025 - We’ve added a new Critical Alerts setting for the KnowBe4 platform! This setting allows you to subscribe to receive critical and time-sensitive notifications for your KnowBe4 platform. For more information, see our KnowBe4 Platform Notifications article.
October 2025
  • October 30, 2025 - We've added SmartRisk Agent™ criteria to Smart Groups functionality, so admins can set specific Risk Score values using more operators for Risk Score and select from seven security type categories. Admins can also apply optional time frames for change-based comparisons. For more information, see our Smart Groups Glossary of Criteria Types.
  • October 10, 2025 - We’ve released a new Organization Chart filter for our Phishing Activity Reports, Training Activity Reports, and our Manager Risk Score Report! This filter allows you to view data for selected managers and their direct and indirect reports. For more information, see the articles below:

    • Customize and View Phishing Activity Reports

    • Customize and View Training Activity Reports

    • SmartRisk Agent™ and Risk Score Guide

  • October 8, 2025 - We now offer two download options for SCORM content that is available in multiple languages. You can download the full SCORM package for each language or a remote-hosted file that contains links to all available language versions on KnowBe4's servers. For more information, see our Download Files from Your KnowBe4 Account article.
September 2025
  • September 5, 2025 - We’ve added a Cornerstone OnDemand (CSOD) integration to the KSAT console. This integration allows admins to assign KnowBe4 content to learners, who will interact with it directly through the Cornerstone Learning platform. For more information, see our Cornerstone Guide.
  • September 2, 2025 - We’ve added a Sprinto integration to the KSAT console. This integration allows you to automatically update training completion statuses based on real-time campaign data, which reduces manual effort and ensures you have audit-ready evidence. For more information, see our Integrate Sprinto with Your KSAT Console article.
August 2025
  • August 13, 2025 - We’ve released a new Security Role for the KnowBe4 Academy! Now, users who have the KnowBe4 Academy Security Role can access to the academy. For more information, see our Security Roles Guide.
  • August 13, 2025 - We’ve added a Seemplicity integration to the KSAT console. The Seemplicity platform is a Remediation Operations (RemOps) platform that accelerates risk reduction and streamlines security compliance workflows. Integrating with KSAT allows you to receive findings about training completion status via the Seemplicity platform. For more information, see our Integrate Seemplicity with Your KSAT Console article.
July 2025
  • July 31, 2025 - We’ve added a Cisco Duo integration to the KSAT console. This integration allows you to sync and manage your Cisco Duo users within the KSAT console through SCIM. For more information, see the Configure Automated Provisioning article from Duo and our SCIM Integration Guide.
  • July 29, 2025 - We’ve added key metrics templates in the Text Block widget to our executive reports feature! Now, you can include automated templates showcasing your organization’s key performance indicators in your executive reports. For more information, see the Executive Reports Widgets section on our Executive Reports Overview.
  • July 29, 2025 - We've updated the audit log to include more options for the Timeframe field and added a toggle button to include API events only in your filter. For more information, see our Audit Log Overview article.
  • July 28, 2025 - We've enhanced the Managed ModStore with custom content upload capabilities. You can access the new Uploaded Content subtab to add your own materials to use in any of your chosen managed accounts. Once uploaded, you can use custom content the same way that you use any ModStore content. For more information, see our Partner and Multi-Account: Upload Custom Training Content article.
  • July 21, 2025—We’ve updated our PasswordIQ client! Now, if LDAP is not available, PasswordIQ uses the third RPC protocol as backup. We’ve also improved the way PasswordIQ reads Active Directory Domain Controller group policies. For more information, see our PasswordIQ Product Manual.
  • July 10, 2025 - We’ve streamlined user messaging. Creating a message is a single, viewable, and editable form. Templates include current and past custom messages, Scam of the Week (SotW), and Security Hints and Tips (SH&T). Scheduling has been expanded with an updated date picker and granular selection of templates. Users can schedule and plan messages for upcoming events, such as Cybersecurity Awareness Month, and recurring message campaigns. For more information, see our User Messaging Guide.
  • July 9, 2025 - AI translations are now available on the KnowBe4 Community! Now, you can use the Translate drop-down menu to translate posts and replies into your preferred language. For more information, see the Interacting with Posts section of our KnowBe4 Community Guide.
June 2025
  • June 30, 2025 - We’ve added a new free tool, the KnowBe4 Program Maturity Assessment (PMA)! The PMA gives you quick insight into what level your organization ranks regarding its security culture and risk awareness. This assessment evaluates your organization across 40 maturity indicators in ten critical dimensions of human risk management and gives it a level one through five. Once your results have been calculated, you can download a full PMA report with an action plan customized for your organization. For more information, see our Program Maturity Assessment (PMA) Overview article.
  • June 20, 2025 - We’ve added the Audiocast option to the Content Types drop-down menu in the Learner Experience (LX) Library tab. For more information, see our Optional Learning Guide.
  • June 19, 2025 - We have updated the KSAT Phishing tab user interface to Svelte! This update changes the appearance of the Phishing tab, reducing the amount of space on the sides of users' screens.
  • June 13, 2025 - We have changed how our PDF attachments work. We've discontinued using JavaScript beacons in PDF attachments because Microsoft Defender and potentially other security tools were blocking them. Instead, opens are recorded when users click on links embedded within the PDF documents. For more information, see our Phishing Campaign Attachments Overview article.
May 2025
  • May 29, 2025 - We've added a new Risk Score Activity report to our Risk Score v2 Reports! This report allows you to view your overall Risk Score activity. For more information, see our Customize and View Your Risk Score Activity Report article.
  • May 20, 2025 - We've added an Enable Standardized CSVs toggle in the Reports section of our Partner Account Settings. For more information and for a list of available reports and CSV files, see the Date Format on CSVs section in our KnowBe4 Console Account Settings: Reports article.
  • May 1, 2025 - We've enhanced our Industry Benchmark Data by updating Organization Size and Program Age (formerly called Program Maturity) values. The Large organization size has been updated to 1,000-9,999 users. We've added a Very Large organization size for organizations with 10,000+ users, and added program ages of 2 Years and 3 Years. For more information, visit our Industry Benchmarking Overview article.
April 2025
  • April 30, 2025 - We've released the ENGAIZ ComplySec360™ integration to the KSAT console. ComplySec360™ is an information and security compliance platform that helps startups and small and medium enterprises improve their risk posture and helps with continued compliance with SOC 2, ISO 27001, GDPR, HIPAA, and more. For more information, see the Integrate ENGAIZ ComplySec360™ with Your KSAT Console article in our Knowledge Base.
  • April 16, 2025 - We've included additional region-specific phishing languages when you create a phishing campaign for better localization support. For more information, please see our Create and Manage Phishing Campaigns article.
  • April 7, 2025 - We've launched the KnowBe4 Academy! Now, you can learn how to use and integrate KnowBe4's products successfully. The following modules are now available:
    • PhishER 101
    • KSAT 101
    • Free Tools 101
    • KnowBe4 101
  • For more information, see our KnowBe4 Academy Guide.
  • April 2, 2025 - Scam of the Week messages are now available in 34 languages for better localization support. For more information, see our Scam of the Week Newsletter Overview.
  • April 2, 2025 - We've added the ability to set a default Phish Alert Button (PAB) in your account settings. For more information, see our Phish Alert Button (PAB) Product Manual.
March 2025
  • March 31, 2025 - We've added a new PasswordIQ Graph API. Now, you can use GraphQL to call and interact with your PasswordIQ data. For more information, see our KnowBe4 Graph API Overview.
  • March 31, 2025 - We've added a new Graph API for SecurityCoach! Now, you can use GraphQL to call and interact with your SecurityCoach data. For more information, see our KnowBe4 Graph API Overview article.
  • March 26, 2025 - We've released a new Organization Chart filter for our executive reports! This filter allows you to view data for selected managers and their direct and indirect reports. With this filter, you can also search by specific job titles. For more information, see our Executive Reports Overview.
  • March 26, 2025 - We've added new phishing topic menus to the Phishing Templates subtab! Now, you can quickly view and organize your phishing templates by topic using the My Topics and System Topics sidebar menus. For more information, see our Phishing Templates Advanced Features Guide.
  • March 24, 2025 - We've added some new features to improve your managed executive reporting, including a new PAB (Phish Alert Button) Activities widget, a new trend line, and the ability to download executive report widgets. For more information, see our Partner and Multi-Account: Executive Reports Overview.
  • March 24, 2025 - We've added a new PAB (Phish Alert button) Activities widget to our Executive Reports subtab! Now, you can include detailed information about how your organization uses the PAB in your executive report. For more information, see the Executive Reports Widgets section of our Executive Reports Overview article.
  • March 24, 2025 - We've added new features to improve your executive reporting, including a new linear trend line, downloadable executive report widgets, and the ability to search by executive report name. Also, executive reports will now be sorted by newest created with the report owner displayed in the search results. For more information, see our Executive Reports Overview article.
  • March 20, 2025 - We've released Red Vector's Fulcrum integration to the KSAT console. Fulcrum is an intelligence platform designed to enhance insider risk management. Integrating Fulcrum with KSAT can help you identify possible workplace threats earlier by performing risk analysis. This integration also allows you to assign training campaigns to reduce workplace risks. For more information, see the Integrate Red Vector's Fulcrum with Your KSAT Console article in our Knowledge Base.
  • March 12, 2025 - We've updated Second Chance to version 2.0.16! This version supports Second Chance functionality in Microsoft's new Outlook for Windows.
February 2025
  • February 28, 2025 - Admins can now download completion certificates in bulk from the Users subtab of a training campaign. This option creates a .zip file containing certificates for selected users in .pdf format. For more information, see the User Management in Training Campaigns article.
  • February 27, 2025 - We updated the Not Opened outcome to No Action on the Phishing Test Results filter in our executive reports. For more information on executive reporting, see our Executive Reports Overview.
  • February 24, 2025 - Gradient MSP released an integration to the KSAT console. This integration enables partners to synchronize the latest active user counts from their KnowBe4 customer accounts, ensuring accurate billing based on the actual number of active users rather than the originally ordered seat count. For more information, see Gradient's Overview and Configuration Guide: Integrating KnowBe4 KSAT with Gradient article.
  • February 18, 2025 - We've released a Tidal Cyber integration to the KSAT console. This integration allows you to efficiently assess, organize, and optimize your cyber defenses based on a deep understanding of the threats and adversaries that are most relevant to you. Phishing Security Test (PST) activity can also be integrated into your Tidal Cyber platform. For more information, see the Integrate Tidal Cyber into Your KSAT Console article in our Knowledge Base.
  • February 6, 2025 - We've updated PasswordIQ to version 1.0.24! In this version, we updated the software license agreement and fixed a bug that prevented PIQ from connecting to the domain controller during scans. As a result of improvements, the minimum RAM for installation has increased to 4 GB. For more information, visit our PasswordIQ Product Manual.
January 2025
  • January 30, 2025 - Hiding a phishing campaign from your reports now applies to Risk Score v2. For more information, see our Hide a Phishing Campaign from Reports article.
  • January 27, 2025 - We've released a CYE Hyver integration to the KSAT console. This integration allows you to create findings based on data from phishing simulation outcomes and compliance gaps discovered during KnowBe4's security awareness training in your organization. For more information, see the Integrate CYE's Hyver with Your KSAT Console article in our Knowledge Base.
  • January 10, 2025 - We've released a Mirage integration to the KSAT console. This integration allows you to sync Mirage simulation events directly into your KSAT console for reporting, training, and targeting purposes. For more information, see our Integrate Mirage with Your KSAT Console article in our Knowledge Base.
  • January 7, 2025 - We've added the option to select specific template languages when creating a phishing campaign. For more information, see our Create and Manage Phishing Campaigns article.
  • January 7, 2025 - We've added an Enable Standardized CSVs toggle in the Reports section of our Account Settings. For more information and for a list of available reports and CSVs, see our KnowBe4 Console Account Settings: Reports article.
  • January 5, 2025 - The CSV file downloads from the phishing campaign Users subtab have been updated to show only phishing test data visible on each column header. All phishing test data is available when downloading the CSV file from the Recipients column header. For more information about accessing phishing campaign data, please visit the Phishing section of our Security Awareness Training Console Reporting Overview article.
  • January 2, 2025 - We've added new Active Directory Integration support and SCIM provisioning support for user language, out-of-office, and user type fields. Now, you can sync user phishing and training language fields, sync out-of-office end fields, and Student Edition customers can sync their user type field to set a student user type. For more information, see our Active Directory Integration (ADI) Guide and our SCIM Configuration Guide.
Release Date Description
December 2024
  • December 20, 2024 - We've released our False-Positive Phishing Evasion feature! If you are experiencing false positives, you can enable this feature in your Account Settings, and then you should see a significant decrease in future false positives. Once the feature is enabled, you will be able to see data about these ignored failures on a new Phishing Campaigns page. For more information, see our False-Positive Phishing Evasion Settings article in our Knowledge Base.
  • December 10, 2025 - We've released our SmartRisk Agent™ and Risk Score v2 Report for partners! With Risk Score v2, you can view more detailed information on your managed accounts' Risk Score, such as security types, risk factors, available range for risk, and risk insights. For more information, see our SmartRisk Agent™ and Risk Score v2 Guide.
November 2024
  • November 26, 2024 - We've updated four of our free tools! We've added a shared library to improve the Microsoft Active Directory functionality for the following free tools:
    • Weak Password Test: version 1.10.3.327
    • Breached Password Test: version 1.10.1.327
    • Password Exposure Test: version 1.10.2.327
    • Browser Password Inspector: version 1.10.0.327
  • We've updated our PasswordIQ client to improve product security.
  • We also upgraded our development environment from Microsoft Visual Studio 2019 to 2022.
  • November 25, 2024 - We've released an XM Cyber Security Control Monitoring (SCM) integration to the KSAT console. This integration provides you with insights into the configuration and activation of security controls. For more information, see our Integrating XM Cyber's SCM with KSAT article in our Knowledge Base.
  • November 8, 2024 - Our new phishing templates user experience is now available for managed accounts. For more information, see our Phishing Templates Guide.
  • November 6, 2024 - We've released a Trustero integration. This integration allows you to better collect evidence for more robust reporting. For more information, see our Integrating Trustero with KSAT article in our Knowledge Base.
  • November 5, 2024 - Anonymized accounts can now group comparisons by User Groups in their Phishing Security Test Reports. For more information on anonymized accounts, see our Anonymous Console Data Overview.
October 2024
  • October 23, 2024 - We've released more updates to our new SmartRisk Agent™ and Risk Score v2. Now, Risk Score v2 uses risk data across our entire platform to provide you with a multidimensional Risk Score for your users, groups, and managers and a new Manager Risk Score report to identify team-specific risk areas. For more information, see our Smart Risk Agent™ and Risk Score v2 Guide.
  • October 16, 2024 - We've released our KSAT Graph APIs! Our KSAT Graph APIs allow you to utilize complex queries and mutations to perform most functions of the supported KnowBe4 products via API. For more information, see our KSAT Graph API documentation.
  • October 3, 2024 - We've released our new SmartRisk Agent™ and Risk Score v2. With Risk Score v2, you can view more detailed information on your Risk Score, such as security types, risk factors, your available range for risk, and risk insights. Risk Score v2 is available on the Reports tab and the Executive Reports subtab. For more information, see our Smart Risk Agent™ and Risk Score v2 Guide.
  • October 1, 2024 - We've released a Harmonic Security integration. This integration allows you to link your Harmonic Security platform to your KSAT console, allowing new workflows for security awareness training. For more information, see our Integrating Harmonic Security with KSAT Using Tines article in our Knowledge Base.
September 2024
  • September 30, 2024 - We've released a Comcast Databee integration. This integration allows you to send phishing information from KSAT to Databee to get risk insights within your organization. For more information, see the KnowBe4 integration documentation from Databee.
  • September 9, 2024 - We added a new [[certificate_list]] placeholder to our Campaign Completion Notifications. This placeholder provides a list of links to certificates for each piece of content completed in the campaign. For more information, see our Training Information Placeholders Guide.
August 2024
  • August 27, 2024 - We have released our Google User Provisioning (GUP) feature! You can now provision users from your Google Workspace environment directly into your KnowBe4 console. User provisioning can be configured to include users and groups, Google OUs, or a combination of both. This feature is being gradually released for all customers over the next few weeks. For further information, see our Google User Provisioning (GUP) Guide.
  • August 23, 2024 - We've added a QR code attack vector to our phishing template features! For more information, see the System Templates section of our Phishing Templates Guide.
  • August 26, 2024 - We've updated our reporting APIs to allow you to return the store purchase ID for each training enrollment, to exclude the ‘completion_percentage' field from the response to greatly speed up response time, and to return a specific employee number. For more information, see the Training section of our Reporting API documentation.
  • August 12, 2024 - We've added an Onyxia integration to the KnowBe4 console. This integration allows you send training information from KSAT to Onyxia to get strategic cybersecurity program recommendations. For more information, see our Integrate Onyxia with your KnowBe4 Console article.
  • August 07, 2024 - We've added a Truto integration to the KnowBe4 console. This integration allows you to set up and perform specific actions between KnowBe4 and other applications using the Truto Unified API. For more information, see the KnowBe4 API integration and KnowBe4 SCIM API integration articles from Truto.
  • August 01, 2024 - We've updated the functionality of our Partner and Multi-Account Executive Reports! Now, these reports will be downloaded in the language of the partner admin who initiated the download. For more information, see our Partner and Multi-Account: Executive Reports Overview.
July 2024
  • We've updated our Scam of the Week newsletter design! Our updated template includes improved responsiveness and accessibility, as well as a more modern design. We are also in the process of updating our Security Hints & Tips newsletter with a similar design! For more information, please see our KnowBe4 Community Post. Note that you must be logged in to your KnowBe4 console in order to access the link.
  • We are retiring some phishing template categories by the end of August. If you are using these categories in a phishing campaign, please update your campaigns:
    • Coronavirus Alerts (Branded) (Not PST)
    • Coronavirus Alerts (Not PST)
    • Coronavirus/COVID-19 Phishing
    • Brand Knock-Offs
      • Templates within this category can still be accessed through the new Phishing Templates interface.
    • Attachments with Macros
      • Templates within this category can still be accessed through the new Phishing Templates interface.
  • We've released our newest free tool, BreachSim! This data exfiltration simulator can help you determine how susceptible your organization is to data theft during a cyber attack. For further information, see our BreachSim Guide or visit our BreachSim sign-up page.
June 2024
  • A new security advisory has been posted. View it here.
  • We've released our Quiz Interactions Reports! Now, you can use your users' quiz results and their selected answers to help you identify trends, such as commonly missed questions. For more information, see our Quiz Interactions Reports Overview article.
  • We've updated SAML settings for our Partner consoles. Now, partners have the ability to disable password logins and require admins to log in with their SAML application. Partners now also have the ability to control if new partner admin accounts get created during the initial SAML authentication. For more information, see our Partner and Multi-Account: Enable SAML on Your Account Management Console article.
  • We've added the Impersonate User button! This button is now available in the User Dashboard subtab and allows you to see what your users see when they log in to their KnowBe4 console. For more information, see our User Profile Guide.
  • Our Free Phishing Security Test (PST) Coronavirus template has been updated to a new Adobe Acrobat Sign template! This template does not use spoofing and is an alternative to the default template choices.
  • We've added two quiz interactions reports to the Reports tab. Quiz Interactions by Course allows you to see quiz results for individual users sorted by content. Quiz Interactions by Group allows you to see quiz results by group. For more information, see our Reporting Guide.
  • We've added the Impersonated and Forced Completion badges under the Users subtab of a training campaign. For more information see our User Management in Training Campaigns article.
  • We've added a Training Topic field when adding details for your uploaded content. For more information, see the Adding Content Details section of our Upload Custom Training Content article.
May 2024
  • The phishing industry benchmarking data has been updated on your Dashboard, in phishing reports, and advanced reports. For more information, see our Industry Benchmarking Overview article.
  • We've added an MobileMind integration to the KnowBe4 console. This integration allows you to send KnowBe4 training data to your MobileMind platform to provide a centralized place for tracking KnowBe4 courses. For more information, see the KnowBe4 integration setup from MobileMind.
  • We have rebranded our Kevin Mitnick Security Awareness Training (KMSAT) to KnowBe4 Security Awareness Training (KSAT).
  • We've removed the Entire History option from our Training Activity Reports.
  • We've added the option to Track SCORM Interactions under the Training section under Account Settings. This option sends users' responses in interactive SCORM activities to the KnowBe4 learning management system (LMS). For more information, see our KnowBe4 Console Account Settings: Training article.
  • New: KnowBe4 Student Edition
    • KnowBe4 Student Edition is now available as an add-on for existing KSAT customers, providing resources for students to safely navigate the digital world. Learn More.
April 2024
  • We have released some design improvements to the Dashboard tab, including a wider view and a more consistent interface.
  • We've added an anecdotes integration to the KnowBe4 console. This integration allows you to send phishing, training, and user data from your KnowBe4 console to your anecdotes platform to automate and manage your compliance program. For more information, see our Integrate anecdotes with Your KnowBe4 Console article.
  • We've updated our PasswordIQ client to improve product security.
  • We've added an Okta Connectors integration to the KnowBe4 console. This integration allows you to use the KnowBe4 Reporting API to pull data into Okta. For more information, see Okta's KnowBe4 connector documentation.
  • We've updated the behavior of our Security Role permissions for training campaigns scoped to targeted groups. Now, your users with this Security Role will see training campaigns for the groups they have access to. Any users outside of the targeted groups will have their enrollments hidden within the training campaign.
  • We've updated our reporting APIs to include a query parameter for returning the campaign ID for training enrollments. For more information, see the Training section of our KSAT Reporting APIs documentation.
  • We've added a Noetic Cyber integration to the KnowBe4 console. This integration allows you to pull your phishing and training data into Noetic Cyber's Security Asset Management platform. For more information, see our Integrate Noetic Cyber with Your KnowBe4 Console article.
  • The standard report emailed to admins at the end of a Phishing Security Test has been updated. The email now lists more specific failure types, such as QR code failures, macros enabled, and data entered.
  • We've rolled out design improvements to the Reports subtab! Now, report types are displayed as cards that list the specific reports found under that type. You can also filter reports by category and favorite your frequently used reports. For more information, read our Reporting Guide.
  • We've added numbers for Chile, Argentina, Colombia, Brazil, and France for callback phishing campaigns.
  • Starting in January 2025, Second Chance will be a Diamond-level KSAT feature. For more information, see our Second Chance Installation and Product Manual.
March 2024
  • We've released improvements to user messaging, making it easier to set up your Scam of the Week and Security Hints and Tips messages. To learn more, see our User Messaging Guide.
  • We've improved our phishing templates to include an option to show excluded topics and to allow bulk cloning. For more information, see our Phishing Templates (Beta) Advanced Features Guide article.
  • We've added our smart hosting feature to your account settings! Now you can set up a connection directly with KnowBe4's mail server and streamline your whitelisting, all from your KnowBe4 console. For more information, see our Smart Hosting article.
  • We've released the Executive Reports feature for partners and multi-account organizations! If you have a Bulk Diamond subscription, you can now create custom reports that include data like your accounts' training activity, phishing activity, and Risk Score metrics. For more information, see our Partner/Multi-Account: Executive Reports Overview.
  • We've added a new SAML feature that allows you to view how long your SAML AuthnRequest certificate is valid for and choose when to update the authentication certificate. With this feature, you can also enable email notifications to alert you when your AuthRequest is about to expire and has expired. For more information, see the SAML section of our KSAT Account Settings: Account Integrations article.
February 2024
  • We are gradually releasing some design improvements to the Users tab, including a wider view and a more consistent interface.
  • We've added a ServiceNow integration to the KnowBe4 console. This integration allows you to get detailed information about your organization's phishing preparedness. For more information, see ServiceNow's KnowBe4 Integration for SecOps article.
  • We have released the Environment Survey on the Dashboard! Your survey responses enable us to provide you with updates that could impact your KnowBe4 experience, and will also help us to plan future product integrations. For more information, see our Environment Survey Overview.
  • We've updated our messaging for Scam of the Week and Security Hints and Tips. Now you can select the day you want to send your message. For more information, see our What Is the Scam of the Week Newsletter? and What Is the Security Hints and Tips Newsletter? articles.
  • We are rolling out design improvements to the Browse and Library subtabs in the ModStore. Improvements include a new layout on the item details page, a toggle to hide content already added to your library, and a language count that displays how many languages an item is available in. For more information, see our ModStore and Library Guide.
  • We've updated our Account Settings page. Admins can now require Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) for users and admins across their organization. For more information, see our updated KSAT Account Settings: User Management article.
January 2024
  • We have released the individual leaderboard! This new leaderboard is based on simulated phishing tests and encourages users to compete on how well they use the Phish Alert Button (PAB). For more information, see our Learner Support: Leaderboard Guide.
  • We've updated our reporting APIs to include queries for callback phishing campaigns on our phishing endpoints. For more information, see the Phishing section of our KSAT Reporting APIs documentation.
  • Our free tool Weak Password Test has been updated to include a new password library, language support for Portuguese (Brazil) and Spanish (Latin America), and the ability to import your own custom password text file.
Release Date Description
December 2023
  • DKIM signatures are enabled by default for all accounts created after December 28, 2023. For more information, see our How to Enable and Customize DKIM Signatures article.
  • On the Executive Reports subtab, we've added new filters to the Training Metrics and Phishing Metrics widgets. When creating a table, you can enable the filters to include a total count or weighted average. For more information, see our KSAT Executive Reports Overview article.
  • We've added an audit log for our KSAT console! Now you can view changes in your console and see who made them. For more information, see our Audit Log for KSAT article.
  • On the Download Center subtab of Reports, we've added a Status column. Now you can see if a download is generating, completed, retrying, or has failed.
  • In the Executive Reports subtab, we've updated the Training Metrics widget. Now, you can narrow down these metrics to one or more specific training campaigns. You can also select additional criteria to analyze campaign training, optional learning, and AIDA optional learning. For more information, see our KSAT Executive Reports Overview article.
  • We've added a Liongard integration to the KSAT console. This integration allows you to monitor phishing tests, security awareness campaigns, and users to keep risks under control. For more information, see Liongard's KnowBe4 integration documentation.
  • We've added numbers for Sweden, Ireland, Spain, and Australia for callback phishing campaigns.
  • We've added a COZYROC SSIS+ integration to the KSAT console. This integration allows you to send campaign and user data from your KSAT console into the COZYROC platform. For more information, see our Integrating COZYROC SSIS+ with Your KSAT Console article.
  • In the KnowBe4 Learner App, you can now request an email with a link to automatically log in to the app. For more information, see our Learner Support: KnowBe4 Learner App article.
  • When creating a Security Role, you can now grant assigned users access to the enroll users feature. This allows them to enroll individual users in active training campaigns. For more information, see the Permissions Descriptions section of our How to Use Security Roles article.
November 2023
  • We've added an A-LIGN integration to the KSAT console. This integration allows you to send training data from your KSAT console to your A-LIGN automated compliance system. For more information, see our How to Integrate A-LIGN with Your KSAT Console article.
  • We've added three new resources to introduce the Learner App to your organization. For more information, see our KnowBe4 Learner App Admin FAQ article.
October 2023
  • Admins can now easily invite users to download the KnowBe4 Learner App by using a new feature in the Account Settings > Training > Learner Experience area. This feature sends an email invitation to users with instructions on how to download the app.
  • We are gradually releasing some design improvements to the Training tab, including a wider view and a more consistent interface.
  • On the Campaigns subtab, we've added a Next Test column. This column will show the start time of your next scheduled Phishing Security Test (PST) for recurring phishing campaigns.
  • We've updated one of our KSAT Event Types. Now, our Audit Log event is called Admin Action. For more information, see the User Timeline Subtab section of our User Profile Guide.
  • We've created a new email template so you can test your PAB button and verify that your users know how to use the PAB. For more information, see our How to Use the PAB Test Email article.
  • We've added the new Enable Direct Links in Training Notifications account setting! Now the assignment placeholders can populate assignments as clickable links that take users directly to their training content or as plain text. For more information, see our KSAT Account Settings: Training article.
  • The Smart Group section of the Knowledge Base is new and improved! We've replaced our original Smart Group articles with eight new articles and six new videos to help you get the most out of your Smart Groups. To learn more, see the Smart Groups section of our Knowledge Base.
  • We've made security improvements for our User Event, Product, and Reporting APIs. Now API tokens will be visible only when they are first created. Afterward, only the last 10 digits of the API tokens will be visible in the KSAT console. For the Reporting API, we've also added support for multiple tokens. For more information, see our KnowBe4's User Event API, KnowBe4's Product API, and KnowBe4's Reporting API articles.
September 2023
  • We've created planning resources for phishing and training campaigns! You can use these interactive planning worksheets to outline your settings before creating a campaign in your KSAT console. For more information, see our Phishing and Training Campaign Planning Resources article.
  • We've added the ability to download content in the KnowBe4 Learner App! Downloaded content can be accessed in the app at any time, even while offline. For more information, see our Learner Support: KnowBe4 Learner App article.
  • We've made improvements to PasswordIQ! Along with general fixes to improve your overall experience, we've added new options to disable the vulnerability checks for Password Never Expires and AES Encryption Not Set. To learn more, see our PasswordIQ Product Manual.
  • Resellers, managed service providers (MSPs), and multi-account organizations can now search and sort the Phishing Activity Reports table data in the account management console! We've also added the Failed Phishing Tests column for the All Phishing Activity Grouped by User report. For more information, see our MSP/Reseller/Multi-Account Org: How to Customize and View Phishing Activity Reports article.
  • Resellers, managed service providers (MSPs), and multi-account organizations can now search and sort the Training Activity Reports table data in the account management console! We've also added the Score column for the All Training Activity report. For more information, see our MSP/Reseller/Multi-Account Org: How to Customize and View Training Activity Reports article.

  • We've made improvements to the Weak Password Test free tool! Along with enhancements to the installation wizard, we redefined the types of failures and vulnerabilities and updated the necessary system requirements to run the newest version. For more information, see our Weak Password Test (WPT) Product Manual.

  • We've added a Cisco Duo integration to the KSAT console. This integration allows you to use Cisco Duo to provide your users with single sign-on (SSO) access to KnowBe4. For more information, see Cisco Duo's KnowBe4 integration documentation.

  • We've added a Secureframe integration to the KSAT console. This integration allows you to send your KSAT data to Secureframe to help automate the compliance process. For more information, see our How to Integrate Secureframe with Your KSAT Console article.
  • We've made improvements to the Password Exposure Test free tool! We've redefined the types of failures and vulnerabilities and updated the necessary system requirements to run the newest version. For more information, see our Password Exposure Test article.

  • We've made improvements to the Breached Password Test free tool! We've updated the necessary system requirements to run the newest version. For more information, see our Breached Password Test article.

  • We've added the new Removed option for your webhook training events! Now you can send events to your webhook when users are removed from training campaigns with content, assessments, or policies. For more information, see our Webhooks in Your KSAT Console article.
August 2023
  • We've added an Egress integration to the KSAT console. This integration allows you to send your KSAT data to Egress to help you prepare for phishing attacks and data breaches. For more information, see Egress's KnowBe4 integration documentation.
  • We've added the new Enable Webhook Failure Notifications check box for webhooks! This option sends recipients an email notification when a webhook receives 50 percent of the allowed failed responses in an hour. A second notification will be sent if the webhook exceeds the allowed number of failed responses in an hour and is deactivated. For more information, see our Webhooks in Your KSAT Console article.
  • We've added course durations to users' training certificates! The duration is the estimated time needed to complete the course. For more information, see our How to Download or Print Your Training Certificate article.
  • We've added the ability to preview how your executive reports will look as a PDF file! While previewing a report, you'll have the option to adjust your widgets as needed. For more information, see our KSAT Executive Reports Overview article.
  • For information about the latest ModStore content releases, visit our ModStore Content Releases article.
July 2023
  • We have added Italian as an admin console language. For more information and the full list of available languages, see our Localization Guide.
  • We're gradually rolling out the new callback phishing feature to Diamond customers! You can use this feature to test whether your users will call unknown phone numbers in emails and share sensitive information. For more information, see our How to Create and Manage Callback Phishing Campaigns article.
  • The new Content Manager feature is now available in the ModStore! This feature allows you to set content preferences that create a cohesive user experience for your organization. To learn more about this feature, see our How to Use the Content Manager article.
  • We've added the new Clone Report option for executive reports! Now you can create a new report by cloning an existing custom report. You can then edit the new report as needed. For more information, see our KSAT Executive Reports Overview article.
  • We've added a new search bar to the Training Activity Reports! Now you can search for specific users in the tale by their name or email address. For more information, see our How to Customize and View Training Activity Reports article.

  • We've added a new search bar to the Phishing Activity Reports! Now you can search for specific users in the table by their name or email address. For more information, see our How to Customize and View Phishing Activity Reports article.

  • We've made improvements to the Phishing Activity Reports! Now you can sort the table data in these reports to fit your needs. We've also added the Failed Phishing Tests column for the Phishing Activity Grouped by User report. For more information, see our How to Customize and View Phishing Activity Reports article.

  • We've made improvements to the Training Activity Reports! Now you can sort the table data in these reports to fit your needs. We've also added the Score column for the All Training Activity report. For more information, see our How to Customize and View Training Activity Reports article.
  • For information about the latest ModStore content releases, visit our ModStore Content Releases article.
June 2023
  • Resellers, managed service providers (MSPs), and multi-account organizations can now send localized emails in managed phishing campaigns. For more information, see our MSP/Reseller/Multi-Account Org: How to Create a Managed Phishing Campaign article.
  • We've fixed a bug that was causing some API endpoints to incorrectly return a 200 success with a payload of [] when an invalid ID was used. Now the affected API endpoints will return the correct 404 error, which states that the resource was invalid and could not be found.

  • We've made improvements to PasswordIQ! You can now scan individual Organizational Units and select a specific domain controller. We've also made changes to the time-out policy and AES vulnerabilities, and we've added various bug fixes. To learn more, see our PasswordIQ Product Manual.

  • We've launched the KnowBe4 Community! Now you can connect, share knowledge, and collaborate on new ideas with other admins, partners, and employees. For more information, see our KnowBe4 Community Guide.
  • The phishing industry benchmarking data has been updated on your Dashboard, in phishing reports, and advanced reports. For more information, see our What Is Industry Benchmarking? article.

  • We've added QR code phishing to our free tools! You can use this tool to see if your users are vulnerable to QR code phishing attacks. For more information, see our Free QR Phishing article.

  • We are releasing a new feature called User Messaging. This feature allows you to send messages to users within the KSAT platform. You can send custom messages or our Scam of the Week and Security Hints and Tips newsletters. Users will be able to read their messages under the new Messages tab in the Learner Experience. This option counts the number of Phishing Security Tests a user has failed, instead of the number of failures the user has had. You may also notice that we rearranged the Phish Event drop-down menu.   • We released our new PhishER APIs to allow you to evaluate all of the suspicious emails that make it through to your users' inboxes. For more information, visit our KnowBe4 API Reference Guide and our KnowBe4 PhishER API article.

  • You can now sign out of all current sessions of your KnowBe4 console from your admin or user profile. Click on your email in the right-hand corner and select Profile. Then, click the Sign Out of All Sessions button at the bottom of the page.
  • We are gradually releasing a change to the maximum session length for all users. This may impact the User Settings currently saved in your Account Settings. See the changes listed below.

    • After 8 hours of inactivity, all admin console and learner experience sessions will time out. When the user returns, they will be asked to sign in again.

    • All admin console and learner experience sessions will be restricted to 12 hours—regardless of activity. A notification will display prompting the user to sign out before the session ends. If they do not sign out, the session will end and the user will be asked to sign in again to continue.

  • AwareGO was added as a publisher in the ModStore and is available with Diamond-level subscriptions.
  • The "2018 Creating Strong Passwords" module is now available in 20 additional languages (Gold/Platinum/Diamond subscriptions).
  • A new version of PAB was released (1.1.16). See Phish Alert Release Notes for details.
  • A reporting API for Phishing data was released and allows customers to pull Phishing data from their consoles. For more information, see the links below:
    • KnowBe4 API Manual
  • A new category of "Security Hints & Tips" templates was added to System Phishing Templates which automatically include your organization logo. Look for the (Branded) tag on the category.
  • The MSP/Reseller Console's Dashboard page was updated to include more information, including subscription level and end date, number of active accounts, number of purchased seats, and number of active seats (paid/free/trial).
December 2017
  • Security Roles feature release
  • New customers with Diamond-level subscriptions will not have any training content automatically added to their accounts.
    • You can select the content suitable for your organization, from the ModStore. Learn more here.
  • Second Chance feature release
    • You can enable Second Chance in your existing KnowBe4 account by updating your Account Settings.
  • Additions to Training Campaign "Users" page, including the date the user was enrolled, how much time is left for each user, and if the user acknowledged any policy assigned to a training module in a particular campaign.
    • Check out this quick video explaining the changes.
  • You can now see the length of available videos in the ModStore.
November 2017
  • Securable.io was added to our list of publishers within the ModStore.
October 2017
  • Smart Groups feature release
  • Active Directory Integration (ADI) Version 1.0.11.0 released
    • This version adds support for synchronizing group membership using a user's primary group. There is no need to upgrade functioning ADI deployments to this new version.
  • Update to Free Phishing Test version 2.0 (additional template and landing page options offered) on EU server
September 2017
  • Active Directory Integration (ADI) Version 1.0.10.0 released
    • Addresses an issue with group synchronization when using userPrincipalName as the email address. If you are not experiencing issues with your ADI services, there is no need to upgrade your ADI version.
  • Phish Alert Button (PAB) Version 1.1.11 released
    • Addresses rare scenario where the Outlook Ribbon was disappearing. If you are experiencing this issue please see our Phish Alert Button (PAB) Release Notes. If you are not experiencing issues there's no need to update.
August 2017
  • MSP/Resellers: Ability to import and export Phishing Templates, Landing Pages, and Training Notifications is now available when logging into accounts via your Reseller console.
  • We've updated our training notification placeholders to be functional in manager and admin templates. The following placeholders: [[email]], [[first_name]], [[last_name]], and [[display_name]] were updated and can be used in notifications directed towards managers and admins.
  • Improvements were made to the User List and Group Member List interfaces. You can now sort all columns, show/hide specific columns, and increase/decrease the number of entries per page.
  • Enhancements made to the Phish Alert Button. You can now set up multiple Phish Alert Button instances for your organization, allowing greater PAB customization.
July 2017
  • Automated Security Awareness Program (ASAP) feature release
  • Active Directory Integration (ADI) Version 1.0.9.0 released
    • Addresses a crashing issue with the ADI service when an Active Directory has missing email address information. If you are not experiencing issues with your ADI services, there is no need to upgrade your ADI version.
June 2017
  • Password-less logins feature released
  • Anonymous console data feature released
  • Enhancements to training campaigns and notifications
    • You can now notify users, user managers, and admins with a variety of notification types
    • Additional manual notifications added
    • Ability to dynamically create training notifications while in training campaign creation screen was added
    • Training Notification categories are displayed under template selection drop-down

  • Weak Password Test feature released
  • Location field was added to CSV downloads

  • Reply-to is off by default on Phishing Campaign
  • SSO links are now available in your Account Settings
  • Ability to clone campaigns was added
  • My Purchased Items will show the most current items at the top
  • Added Sender's Name for Training Notification templates

  • Updates and improvements to Training Campaign Creation Screen

    • Ability to create campaigns with a "relative duration"

  • Added HTML Attachment and HTML Attachment with Link available attack vectors on Phishing Template Creation screen
